sessions.name: Introduction to Angular JS
sessions.speaker: John Doe
sessions.abstract: In this session you will learn about the basics of Angular JS

sessions.name: Scopes in Angular JS
sessions.speaker: John Doe
sessions.abstract: This session will take a closer look at scopes.  Learn what they do, how they do it, and how to get them to do it for you.

sessions.name: Controllers
sessions.speaker: Jane Doe
sessions.abstract: Controllers are the beginning of everything Angular does. They contain business logic used by your views

sessions.name: Services
sessions.speaker: Jane Doe
sessions.abstract: Services implement the business logic that is used across an application. A common use case is to make backend calls

sessions.name: Directives
sessions.speaker: Rob Smith
sessions.abstract: Directives are ways to teach HTML new tricks. Directives are either custom HTML elements or attributes. They encapsulate markup and functionality, and help create reusable widgets that can be used in the app at many places.

sessions.name: Introduction to React JS
sessions.speaker: Paul Smith
sessions.abstract: In this session you will learn about the basics of React JS

sessions.name: JSX
sessions.speaker: Paul Smith
sessions.abstract: Learn how to use JSX to create view and bind data to it

sessions.name: Props and children
sessions.speaker: Jane Doe
sessions.abstract: Use props and children to pass data

sessions.name: Components
sessions.speaker: Jane Doe
sessions.abstract: Create custom stateful and stateless components. Compose components to create your application.

sessions.name: State and application lifecycle
sessions.speaker: Rob Smith
sessions.abstract: Store application data in state and make your application respond to events

sessions.name: React router
sessions.speaker: Rob Smith
sessions.abstract: Add React router to build an SPA

sessions.name: State and application lifecycle
sessions.speaker: Rob Smith
sessions.abstract: Redux provides an architecture for state manipulation in your app. Add Redux to store the state of your app, and make your app respond to changes in state.

sessions.name: Introduction to NoSQL databases
sessions.speaker: Ramcharan Gupta
sessions.abstract: What NoSQL is and how it is different from RDBMSes

sessions.name: Understanding Mongo DB
sessions.speaker: Ramcharan Gupta
sessions.abstract: Mongo DB and its features shall be briefly introduced

sessions.name: Designing Schemas for Mongo DB
sessions.speaker: Jane Doe
sessions.abstract: Schema design for Mongo DB is quite different from that of traditional databases. Learn the art of designing Mongo DB database schemas for the application at hand

sessions.name: Aggregation pipeline
sessions.speaker: Rob Smith
sessions.abstract: Learn how to use the aggregation pipelines to generate reports
